Bioshock Infinite was, in my opinion, the best out of the series. It is beautiful, exciting, and mindf***ingly brilliant. I would definatly recommend this to anyone new to the BioShock series or exisitng BioShock fans.

What happens when a game places you in the role of glorified babysitter, to a character you feel little more than indifference toward?  And what if that experience extends to nearly the entirety of your play time?

You and your other:
Elizabeth, the person you as Booker DeWitt have been hired to retrieve intact, and thus protect, follows you throughout nearly the entirety of the game, and when she isn't following you, she's bossing you around, requiring comforting, or being captured and in need of rescue.  This type of scenario is certainly nothing new, but the problem here is that the player cannot simply opt-out or choose a different path if they lack the necessary motivations to perform the task at hand.  I mean, if I'm going to serve as the games punching bag or as an unstoppable killer of seemingly endless hordes of bloodthirsty AI, I have to feel as a player that the ends justify the means.  When you're running all over this maze of a game, impaling, decapitating and quite frankly murdering more or less the entire population, your character's personal troubles along with the troubles of Elizabeth, appear to pale in comparison.  And yes, there is a distinct difference between being forced to defend yourself against the insane, plasmid-addled inhabitants of Rapture, and being forced to obliterate armies of (under other circumstances) somewhat normal and decent citizens of the airborne city of Columbia.  I inflict horrendous brutality X on my one hundredth victim, resulting in their terrible death, and all the while Elizabeth is yammering on about how someone might or might not be her real father, or how she feels trapped, or any number of comparatively mild issues that come to her mind at any given moment... And the entire time I just want to say to her "SHUT THE %&$@ UP!  Take my hand and let's escape this giant glorified quick time event of a game".

Linearity:
No matter how you decide to traverse a map (which is heavily limited beyond the use of skyrails), or dispatch your enemies, the consequences end up being the same.  You can either play as a body guard, punishment sponge and enemy killer, or as a body guard, punishment sponge and enemy killer.  That's it.  Different play styles play-out in terms of what two weapons you decide to use at any given time, along with what vigors.  And I should mention that enemies almost never use vigors, and are susceptible to almost any weapon or power, so strategy is rarely needed. On top of this, the game has plenty of invisible walls, magically blocked off areas that were previously accessible, and a level of predictability (gameplay wise) beyond most that I've experienced; you just know when you're going to bump into enemies.  In terms of gameplay, it ends up being little more than a rail shooter, dressed up to look more sophisticated than it actually is.

Story (no spoilers):
Starts off simple enough as you're charged with the task of rescuing a damsel, but over the course of the game becomes more and more convoluted to the point that you're just rolling your eyes so hard that it hurts.  Some of the dialogue is good, and some of it is just down right pretentious with all kinds of pseudoscientific mumbo-jumbo being bandied about like no one would notice or care.  Welp, I did.  And I was not impressed.  Something that no one told the writers, is that some things are better left to the imagination of the player; knowing how the city floats is immaterial to telling a good story for example, and is equivalent to revealing that Jedi powers are as a result of midichlorians in the blood.  In a nutshell, the story is needlessly complex and the ending is intensely unsatisfying, especially considering the game felt like a chore to play.

Conclusion:
Bioshock Infinite is a film that aspires to be a game, and garners praise far beyond its merit.
This game is just wonderful! I highly recommend it.

Это прекрасная игра,ее смело можно назвать шедевром!Так ее можно назвать и за прекрасный сюжет,и,по моему, за лучшую героиню в истории видеоигр(Элизабет конечно),и за геймплейную часть,музыкальное оформление тоже на высоте. Игры такого качества как эта,выпускают все реже и реже.Это не просто шутер,не просто игра с хорошим сюжетом и графикой,эта игра сделана с душой,что ясно просматривается во время прохождения.
После прохождения этой игры,меня ждал длительный мозговой штурм,и тридцати минутный серфинг по интернет ресурсам в поисках не достающих частей пазла,ибо концовка просто ошеломляет.
Смело ее вам рекомендую,поиграете-сами все поймете!

Я хочу расcмотреть эту игру с двух сторон.
1. Игра называется Not Bioshock:Infinite.
Шедевр, шикарный сюжет, прекрасные персонажи, отличная графика и динамичный геймплей 10/10.
Спускаемся с небес на землю.
2. Игра называется Bioshock: Infinite.
И тут начинается... Гнетущая атмосфера первых двух биошоков, была и есть фишкой этой серии, чего нет в Infinite и это один из главных минусов. Действие происходит в осветленном прекрасном воздушном городке. Минус к атмосфере и отход от главной темы серии. И наконец... Игра называется Bioshock, т.е. биологический парадокс(мутация), А ГДЕ ТУТ МУТАНТЫ?! ГДЕ ОНИ?! В ДОПОЛНЕНИИ?! ВЫ ЧТО ИЗДЕВАЕТЕСЬ?! ГДЕ МОЙ БИОШОК?! ГДЕ ОН?! В итоге, от меня игра получает 5/10, т.к. они угробили всю серию игр этой убогой Коламбией и присутствием второго главного героя. И да, если кто-то не согласен с моим мнением, то мне насрать, и как по мне, в серии была главной фишкой АТМОСФЕРА, чего я не нашел в новоиспеченном Bioshock. Спасибо за внимание.

Qué decir de este JUEGAZO.

Impresionante en todos los sentidos. Yo que creía que no me gustaban los juegos en primera persona pero desde que probé este la cosa cambió.

100% RECOMENDABLE si te gustan los juegos.

E' la prima "recensione" di un gioco che faccio e debbo dire che questo titolo è semplicemente stupendo, ha una storia molto coinvolgente ed un finale che lascia a bocca aperta.Ho giocato davvero a diversi videogames ma sicuramente questo è quello che fino ad ora più mi ha colpito soprattutto per la narrazione, vivamente consigliato a tutti coloro che amano far parte di un gioco che ti racconta un qualcosa di incredibile.Preferisco decine di titoli come questo piuttosto che capolavori di grafica senza spessore.Voto 10.

One of the most beautiful FPS games I've every played.  The bright atmosphere and costuming was very refreshing.  Infinite is full of action with an engrossing story line that kept me at my computer for hours on end.  By far my favorite game of 2013.
Great game with good mechanics and brilliant mindf**king storyline.

Quasi interamente scollegato dalla storia dei precedenti due episodi, Bioshock Infinite riesce comunque a mantenere un elevato livello di gameplay unito ad un'ottima storyline. Non troviamo sorelline né plasmidi (sostituiti dai vigor), solo una moneta corrente (non soldi e Adam, solo soldi) oltre ai soliti distributori automatici.
Vestiamo i panni di Booker DeWitt, un detective inviato a Columbia da due strani tizi a recuperare una ragazza, Elizabeth... Booker ha uno strano marchio sulla mano destra, AD, il cui significato non verrà chiarito se non negli ultimi istanti della storia.
Emozionante, avvincente, ricco di colpi di scena. 
Leggermente troppo lineare in alcuni tratti, che conferiscono poco spazio al free-roaming, ma a parte questo dettaglio si tratta di un titolo veramente notevole.

Assolutamente consigliato

The best game I have played in a long time.  Probably the best story driven game I have ever played. The plot was well developed and kept you interested through the whole game. The character development was amazing, You really start to feel for the characters in the game which is a nice change from most soulless characters you run across in other games. The only downside was that the story was so compelling that whenever an extended battle came up I found it distracting and I wish I could skip it so I could get back to the story.

Despite a rather weak ending, only a few shades better than the travesty that was Mass Effect 3, this is a very, very good game that I think most people (even those who don't play shooters) will enjoy. The combat is quick, easy (if you want it to be, though it can be made much more difficult) and spectacular, the acting and animation is top notch, and the premise is incredible though proud Americans might need to put their patriotism on a back burner for parts of it. 

 This is a definite must have for most gamers, if the price is daunting, it should be considered a must buy while on sale.

P.S. хотя это 3я часть игры, можно смело играть, не играя во вторую или даже первую. После этой вы их обязательно захотите пройти, это я гарантирую: сюжет подан таким образом, что все будет ясно и понятно и без первых 2х.

Ахрененая игра

Ok to cut this review short in my opinion everybody should experience the great story of BioShock Infinite, well developed story and great character development. BUY IT!!!

Pros: Very pretty to look at, story is amazing, I bought it on sale ( even if its not on sale it's still worth it ), the general atmosphere is very fitting it shows the bad and the flaws in an utopian society and how there's always bad in good. 

Cons: After finishing the game you want MORE, I wish the story was longer ( Then again thats probably why I'm on the fence about buying a season pass... ), In the end you never really feel like you win, no multplayer or co-op, I mean I understand that that would be a strech for them and BioShock's mechanics wouldn't fit into a multiplayer world but it would have been amazing to see.

Verdict: Like I've already said I highly recommend BioShock, no need for more words, buy it.

My absolute favourite game of all time. Just a masterpiece, but I'm regretting reading spoilers.. 10/10

BioShock Infinite is a beautiful game. The underwater cites and sky cities of Columbia alike will leave you in awe. And the storytelling is very well done. You play as a war veteran named Booker DeWitt and your job is to rescue a woman named Elizabeth. You learn about both characters throughout the story up to the very end. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this game. Part of the story comes from the voxophones and little film scores you see and hear throughout it. I literally just finished the game prior to this review so it took me about 10 hours to beat since I took my time listening to and watching things. The end is a mix of a cliffhanger and a satisfaction in my opinion; it's hard to describe without giving it away. All I can say is it'll make you feel different after you see it. But it was worth every penny I spent and I wish I could take it all back just to play it and guess what happens next again. Truly a work of art. 10/10
